description: This course addresses the institutions that comprise modern monetary systems and the influence that these systems have on levels of income, output, employment, and prices in market economies. It addresses in detail monetary theory and monetary policy, including both the nature of our central bank and the role that it plays in our monetary system. Prerequisite: One of ECON 110-121 or permission of instructor.
name: Money and Banking
prerequisites: One of ECON 110-121 or permission of instructor.
